content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.59 - Executive Order No. 59: Temporary Suspension of Provisions Relating to Limitations on Motor and Home Heating Fuel

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on October 26, 2012, I issued Executive Order

Number 47, declaring a disaster emergency in all 62 counties in the State of

New York; and
WHEREAS, the loss of power and damage to infrastructure
caused by the storm has cut off distribution lines associated with motor fuels
and home heating oil, in turn resulting in motor fuel and home heating oil
shortages in the counties of Bronx, Brooklyn, Kings, Nassau, New York, Richmond, Rockland, Suffolk and Westchester; and
WHEREAS, State law and regulations that (i) limit the
amount of vapor pressure and impose vapor lock and distillation class
restrictions on motor fuel and (ii) limit the sulfur content of heating oil are
hindering supplies of motor fuel and home heating oil in the counties of Bronx, Brooklyn, Kings, Nassau, New York, Richmond, Rockland, Suffolk and

Westchester; NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by Section 29-a of Article
2-B of the Executive Law to temporarily suspend specific provisions of any
statute, local law, ordinance, orders, rules or regulations, or parts thereof, of any agency during a State disaster emergency, if compliance with such
provisions would prevent, hinder or delay action necessary to cope with the
disaster, hereby temporarily suspend, for the period from the date of this

Executive Order until further notice and within the territorial boundaries of

Bronx, Brooklyn, Kings, Nassau, New York, Richmond, Rockland, Suffolk and

Westchester Counties, the following laws and regulations: Section
19-0325
of the Environmental

Conservation Law and regulations promulgated thereunder relating to limits on
the sulfur content of heating oil sold in New York; and

Title One of the New York Codes, Rules and Regulations

Section 224.3, authorized pursuant to Sections
16, 18, 179
(3)(a)
of the Agriculture and Markets Law, relating to the vapor pressure, distillation class, and vapor lock protections
set forth therein. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: November 3, 2012
